result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiara L Hallberg

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.pdf

Defendant Kiara L Hallberg appeared by video.  Attorney Olivia G Garman appeared by video for Kiara L Hallberg.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a motion hearing date. State to respond to motion by 12-02-2022. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Suppress, filed by defense

Defendant Kiara L Hallberg in court with attorney John Binder for Olivia G Garman.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kiara L Hallberg appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter requesting adjournment of Scheduling Conference received and forwarded to the Judge for review.  bm

Defendant Kiara L Hallberg in court with Attorney Olivia G Garman.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Court set a scheduling conference date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Kiara L Hallberg in court with attorney Bradley W Novreske.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/1/22 @ 2p
